full_title_en: Primary Care PTSD Screen for DSM-5 (PC-PTSD-5)
medium_description_en: Screens for PTSD in primary care populations.
instructions_en: Use this tool to screen for PTSD in your primary care patient. If the screen is positive, further assessment is necessary.
search_abbreviation_en: Primary Care PTSD Screen for DSM-5 (PC-PTSD-5)

how_to_use.use_case_en: Do you use the Primary Care PTSD Screen for DSM-5 (PC-PTSD-5) and want to contribute your expertise? Join our contributor team!

next_steps.management_en: If the screen is positive, the patient should be further evaluated with additional structured assessments. For additional information about PTSD assessments and research, please visit: https://www.ptsd.va.gov/professional/assessment/screens/pc-ptsd.asp.

about.formula_en:
Examples of traumatic events include:

  • A serious accident or fire.

  • A physical or sexual assault or abuse.

  • An earthquake or flood.

  • A war.

  • Seeing someone be killed or seriously injured.

  • Having a loved one die through homicide or suicide.

First, ask the patient: Have you ever experienced this kind of event?

If no, the PC-PTSD-5 Score = 0.

If yes, the PC-PTSD-5 Score is calculated by the addition of the selected points:

creator_info.about_en: Annabel Prins, PhD, is a professor of psychology at the San José State University in California. She is a member of the International Society for Traumatic Stress Studies and the Association of Behavioral and Cognitive Therapies. Dr. Prins’s primary research is focused on PTSD and increasing awareness of it in non-mental health settings.
